body_html:
hello. i've been looking into my problems with the startup error when Variables are included in the graph (not always - but it fails for all of the variable type unit tests).

protocolbuffers/protobuf#2894

I suspect, after reading a lot of protobuf stuff, that it might be hard/impossible to have a plugin due to protobuf global state / static initializers. i note that it seems to be ok for kernel_op plugins, but they might sidestep some global state issue.

nevertheless, i think that a public headers interface for XLA is a good thing, so that I can have my driver code elsewhere in the repo. At the moment only things in //tensorflow/compiler can access enough of the headers to compile.

body:
hello.   i've been looking into my problems with the startup error when Variables are included in the graph (not always - but it fails for all of the variable type unit tests).

https://github.com/google/protobuf/issues/2894

I suspect, after reading a lot of protobuf stuff, that it might be hard/impossible to have a plugin due to protobuf global state / static initializers.  i note that it seems to be ok for kernel_op plugins, but they might sidestep some global state issue.

nevertheless, i think that a public headers interface for XLA is a good thing, so that I can have my driver code elsewhere in the repo.  At the moment only things in //tensorflow/compiler can access enough of the headers to compile.
